utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hey, welcome to “Hannity.” All right. We are going to change format a little tonight. Buckle up. Far left New York City Mayor, I affectionately call him Comrade de Blasio, 2020 Democratic hopeful. Well, Bill de Blasio, to his credit, he sat down with me for an exclusive one-on-one interview. So far, he's the only 2020 Democrat brave enough to come on this program and we commend him for that. We cover a wide range of issues, went much longer than we thought, Obamacare, socialism, New Green Deal, police officers. No topic was off the table, immigration, abortion, Second Amendment. We got them all in. So, without further ado, buckle up. The media? You are going to love this. Part one.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you support walls on our border?

utterances.speaker: MAYOR BILL DE BLASIO, D-NYC, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I support border security but not walls.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No walls?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I don't think we need additional walls, because -- OK, there's 11 million people here right now, Sean --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: There is more.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Maybe. But this is what I don't get about the whole discussion bluntly on this network and a lot of other places.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Uh-huh.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Eleven million people are here, they've been here for decades. This is the biggest "don't ask, don't tell" in American history. Why are we allowing ourselves to be divided by the people when this already happened?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK, how are you going to --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: There is no invasion. These people here already are part of our community.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Ninety percent of the heroine that comes in to this country crosses the southern border. Fentanyl, a big percentage crosses the southern border. We're losing 300 people a week. You know all about the opioid epidemic in a big city like New York.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: We fight it every day.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We have to -- we have to save these kids. And so, my question is between -- I think the 99 percent of people who want to come here, want what we have, and I don't blame them. There is 1 percent, though -- two- year period, there were 4,000 homicides, 30,000 sexual assaults, 100,000 violent assaults by illegal immigrant criminal. The 1 percent. I want to be very clear. My question to you is very simple. If you don't have a wall, how are you going to stop them?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: People get in with a wall, without a wall, that's not how you do it. What you do is you create an actual border security mechanism, you use every tool you need and you create a reality in our communities where - -

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All across the border, no wall?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Hold on, in our communities where police and communities are working together. In the city, we have 170 crimes, that is if someone convicted, and they are undocumented, they are out of here.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK, but you --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And we work with communities to make sure we find people who have done things that are inappropriate.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You've a sort of half have a sanctuary city and those --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: -- any of these terms, I want to talk about facts.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's the facts: Bill de Blasio has nearly 500,000 illegal immigrants in his city. Those are the facts. Those are the census facts. And you said you want New York taxpayers to pay for their health care.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Sean, right now -- that's another charade. And you have to decide how honest you want to be.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Whoa, whoa, is that not true?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No. Where do they get their health care, Sean?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute, did you not say that?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Wait --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You just accused me of being dishonest. Are there 500,000 --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm asking you -- there's 500,000 people --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you want free health care for everyone, for every New Yorker?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm answering a question. I want every New Yorker --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Legal or illegal?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Everybody who's here --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Illegal or legal?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: -- to get health care.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Because what's happening right now, folks go to the emergency room because they don't have a doctor and who is paying for it? The same taxpayers. The same taxpayers.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So, the answer -- it's a simple question. The answer is yes. Do you support New York City --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Why not have an honest conversation about the reality now?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me finish my thought. Just to be clear, 500,000 illegal immigrants in New York City should get free health care. That's what you just said.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Everyone who lives here gets the health care they need so that everybody could be health, not get each other sick and --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Even if they are illegal?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Even if they're undocumented, I'll tell you why, because otherwise, what's happening, people go to the emergency room, the taxpayers pay anyway.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: People get sicker. So, these are human beings who are part of our economy, who are part of our neighborhood.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Uh-huh.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Right? Every neighborhood in the city, there is not a sign that says who is undocumented.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I got your answer. I understand. Let me move on to the next question.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute, whoa, whoa, two-way street. So, do you agree that people go to the emergency room when they are sick --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I think that we should --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: -- and we end up paying for it anyway?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: If you want to change the laws, my answer is, I believe we should -- no nation, we're a constitutional republic. I revere our Constitution. I revere the rule of law. And I understand I think why 99 percent of people want to be here because they want what we all take for granted that God has given us. I want to have a wall to stop the heroin -- let me finish. Stop the cartels --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but you're not answering my question.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I am answering your question. And I want criminal elements to be vetted and I want a big door that says welcome to our family, welcome to our country.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So, you want comprehensive immigration reform.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm telling you --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, but do you want comprehensive immigration reform? We got 11 million people here right now.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: After we build the wall.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Oh, come on! What about 11 million people who are here?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: After we build the wall and secure our borders, my answer is absolutely, we give those highly coveted slots to the people that respect our laws.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Sean, this is why it's such a charade. You got 11 million --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: A charade?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It is a charade, stop it. What you are doing and what your network does too often is try to distract people --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: My network, by the way, there are people on my network that don't like a single word I say. What are you talking about? We're not monolithic --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I agree you are not a monolith but too much of the time, what FOX and News Corp do is trying to take people's minds off the fact they are being screwed economically by the 1 percent.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We're going to get to that in detail.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, but you're not answering it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, but I promise, after the lightning round, which isn't really lightning, we are going to get back to that. I promise.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You're honestly going to tell me why it's OK that the 1 percent are paying less and less in taxes?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Now that we're back to lightning round, I want to ask you a new question. And we are going to get back --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Are you promising me you're going to answer that question?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We're going to get back to immigration, we're going to get back to taxes, I promise you.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Aha, I'll be watching.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're watching. You're sitting right here. You're watching yourself. Watch the monitor right there, you can watch yourself.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm watching.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. You came with some of New York's Finest. If you go to work every day like the people that are with you to protect you, which I fully support, because these are dangerous times. And they are our police officers and they are armed. And we have a big debate because there are -- I've been a responsible gun owner my entire life. Somebody calls my radio show and says, what kind of gun should I get, Sean? And I'm like, which gun do you want to get trained yourself, and what safety courses are you going to take? It's all serous. My mom was a prison guard on Long Island for 25 years, 16 hour shifts every day.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: God bless her.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And she had a loaded gun next to her bed and she made sure that 10-year-old kid, me, knew how to handle a firearm. So, my question is, you have that. Hollywood stars can afford armed guards. Should every New Yorker, should every American, have the ability of -- God forbid the criminal element invades their home, invades their property, to have a gun in their home to protect themselves. What do you do?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You are in the safest big city in America.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I didn't ask you that.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm prefacing -- you prefaced all the time.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You're in the safest big city in America, finest police force in America. We keep people safe. Crimes gone down six years in a row on my watch.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It's true, thank you. I believe right now, what's wrong in this country is not that people have rights around guns, is that there are no gun safety measures like background checks, like --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We do have background checks. I don't buy a gun without getting a background check.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: We don't have sufficient background checks.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I have a gun -- a carry license in New York. I have to walk over hot coals tot get --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Right, I'm talking about the whole country. And by the way, asked the NYPD and they tell you they believe in strong gun laws to keep officers and civilians safe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But my question is simple, does every New Yorker, if they are mentally stable, if they have the background check and they don't have a criminal background or mental illness problem, average people, should they have the same safety you have? And if somebody breaks into your house, would you respect their right to have a firearm in their house?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Everyone deserves to be safe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I didn't ask for that.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: The answer is not for everyone to have a firearm, any more than --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So, the answer is no.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I believe people have rights but I also believe we need background checks, we need an assault weapon ban, and waiting period per purchase.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Because right now, what's happening --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Every American has a shotgun in their house. Every New Yorker, you are not answering. You're dodging.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm not dodging. All the guns that are out there that are threatening our officers and civilians alike, that's the problem in our society.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I am asking you. Should every New Yorker have the same protection you have?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I believe everyone has the rights. I believe we need new gun safety law and --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I believe people have rights, should they have a right to a gun?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: -- we have a police department and I've added 2,000 officers on patrol on this city in the last few years --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: -- that is making it safer all the time. It's the best way to protect people.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Should every New Yorker that has a perfect mental health -- hold on, have a perfect mental health record and have a background check, would you agree that they have a right --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: They have a right to be safe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- do you agree they have a right to have a gun in their house?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: They have a right to be safe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Great. Do they have a right to a gun? Yes or no?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm answering you. The safest way --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're not answering.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: -- to do is to have us to police department that is supported by --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- by the time you call the cops, even if it's a great response time, you might be dead. DE BLASIO: Again, we just have a different --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're protected. You have a team around you. Does every New Yorker, if somebody breaks into their house, they're good people, they're law-abiding people, who pay their taxes, obey the rules, pass the background check, should they have a right to a gun in their house? Yes or no?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I ain't buying what you are selling.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're not buying. So, the answer is no but you're afraid to say it.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, my answer is my answer. You don't get to tell people what their answers.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Should New Yorkers have a right to a gun n their house?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: The question here is how do we make people safe? It is to have --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It's not my question.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Yes, it is.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That wasn't my question. I didn't ask you that.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: How do we get guns out of this society, they're everywhere, they can't be everywhere. They're threatening our officers and civilians (ph).

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The answer to your question is New Yorkers that have perfect mental who are willing to go through background checks should not be allowed to have a gun in their home?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I just don't play by your rules.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Should they be allowed to --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Now, you do this with everyone, let people define themselves. Do you want to hear the truth? I am telling you --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Can you have a gun is a simple question if they are law-abiding? Can they have a gun?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You are trying to set up a reality where you get to paint a picture on your own terms. It doesn't work that way. I am telling --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Mr. Mayor, those guys over there, what did I say, guys? I said, thank you to what you do every day. They protect you. You deserve to be protected. You are the mayor of the biggest city in the world --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Everyone, everyone deserves to be protected and that's what we are doing here.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But they can't have a gun, can they? You can't have a gun?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Again, ask law enforcement if they want everyone to have a gun. That is not the way to keep everyone safe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Listen, I appreciate you being here, but that is a simple question and you are dodging and ducking and you're flipping --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I have told you what I believe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. That's fair enough. You just say it's in the wrong hands, OK?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I think it's in the wrong hands.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So, here is Sean Hannity that's been financially independent since he's ten. You know all the jobs I've --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Right, I heard it. But what's your answer?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you think my (INAUDIBLE) isn't fair?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you think the money that I've earned and saved is in the wrong hands?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I think --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's a yes or no. Do you think the money I've made is in the wrong hands?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen to what I'm saying. Do you think right now your viewers feel that it's OK that the wealthy have as much as they have and pay as little in taxes?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you think I work --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you think that big corporations pay nothing in taxes, do you think that's OK?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you know how much I made -- no, corporations pass taxes onto people. Corporations don't pay taxes. They will pass --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: There are corporations that pay no taxes in America. Amazon is one of them. Do you think that's OK?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All I know is this, I've always known in my career and we learned it with Lois Lerner, that I better damn well pay my taxes because if I don't, I have no doubt that Obama-Biden would have get rid every tax -- here's what I will say. The kid that started out with no money, and started in radio to work for free and made $19,000 a year, and I left my home in New York and I went five years in Rhode Island, five years California, two years Alabama, four years Georgia, and I got lucky. I got hired here. I'm asking, you still want $0.70 of every dollar I have, and then you want more if I've saved too much, and then you want more when I drop dead. I think you are stealing from me.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I want working-class people and middle-class people to get a better life.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do I deserve that money because you say it's in the wrong hands? Is that my money?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: This is my general view of the world. You got there with the help of friendly government policy. Not taking away your work. I'm not taking away your work. But the rich have gotten richer for 40 years and paid less and less in taxes. Corporations in America are paying nothing in taxes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: That's not America. That's not America where the chosen few --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What do you think corporations when they -- when you raise their taxes, what do you think they do?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I think the problem with your whole line here is that you seem to think the status quo is OK.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I don't think your viewers that the status quo is OK.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What do you think corporations do when government like you raises their taxes?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: They have to pay their fair share.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, they pass the cost onto the consumers. Corporations don't pay taxes. You are right. They pass those costs onto us. We pay.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you think it's okay that their CEOs making 300, 400 times what their workers in their companies are paying?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Listen, let me tell you something. You're talking to the wrong guy. I'm a blue-collar guy. I worked 25 years in real work.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: But I'm saying, do you think it's OK there are CEOs in America making --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you know what I'm most happy about?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: -- 100, 200, 400 times what an average worker in a company is making? Do you think that's OK?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I am so happy that I gave you the numbers under Biden-Obama and I gave you the numbers under Trump. The New York Mets have Ray Sadique (ph), Tom Seaver, Jerry Koosman, Duffy Dyer, Jerry Grote --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I gave the keys to the city. Did you know that?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We've never had -- you did, that's cool, by the way.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I gave the keys of the city to the '69 Mets who are still with us, including Kranepool. And Bud Harrelson --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I gave each of the keys to the city.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Good for you. By the way, when do I get my key to the city?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: If you join the Mets.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh, I've lived in the city.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You join the Mets, you might have a chance. But the -- look, the bottom line is, I don't hear you saying --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You should thank Donald Trump. Do you know why? Because listen, I -- I believe in God. I believe God created every man, woman, child on this earth, with all my heart. I need to be a better Christian, but I want to be a Christian. And I really believe that. And the fact that we have the best employment situation since 1969, the best -- the lowest unemployment, record unemployment.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: OK, but what about people --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: African-Americans, Asian-Americans --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Those are numbers, what about what's happened for decades?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Numbers, those are jobs. Those are people's jobs.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen. What has happened for decades before that? This is what you don't answer. I've been listening for an answer.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I gave you the Obama years.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Since from Reagan until now, the rich have gotten consistently richer, paying less and less taxes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Keep going back to this.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, because 40 years is a long time, we've got to break out of it.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you know what the old days were? Eisenhower and Kennedy, when the wealthy paid at the level I'm proposing, wealth was better shared. There was more investment.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Did you ever run a business?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen, I run a huge, huge --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm not talking about government. Have you ever run a private business?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Excuse me, I have 380,000 employees. I have a budget I have to balance.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, not government. I'm talking non-government. Did you ever run a private business?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm asking you and you do not want to seem to answer the question.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you believe that in the last 40 years, working-class and middle-class people have not moved forward? I think if you ask your viewers, they would tell you that they have not moved forward.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: My grandparents came from Ellis Island.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: That's the point.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Hold on a second.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: That's the point. The American dream they had, we don't have right now.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Hold on, they came here with on average 10 bucks in their pocket, all four of my grandparents. My father grew up poor in (INAUDIBLE), one of the good place at a time, my mom grew up in the South Bronx. They had nothing growing up, absolutely nothing. My father fights in World War II and --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So did my dad.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes, and he got a 50x100 lot, Long Island, $1,300 house? That was success. The question is, yes, we can do better, but we don't -- government is not the answer, Mr. Mayor. You said that money is -- you talk a lot about money being in the wrong hands.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Oh, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute. Are you saying the people that have money stole it?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Can I tell you the exact quote, let's be fair?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Money in the wrong hands.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I say there is plenty of money in this world, there's plenty of money in this country, it's just in the wrong hands.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How did it get there?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Working -- because of federal policies that took from working people and give it to the 1 percent.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK, so you want a wealth tax (ph)?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I want working people to get their fair share. Should anybody be working for less than $50 an hour?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So, let's go -- I don't like the minimum wage --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You don't think people -- you work -- you describe your life as a working man, I respect that. Do you think people should get $15 an hour in today's economy?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, because -- no, because it hurts kids that get jobs. We now have record low unemployment, youth unemployment, and I didn't work as a kid --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute, wait a minute. Talk about people trying to support their family. You do not think people working hard to get $15 minimum-wage? Come on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Mr. Mayor, let me go over the numbers that matter here.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: This is what the labor movement fought for for years.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You said the following, money is in the wrong hands and you want to tax the hell out of people.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I do want and people should go to taxthehell.com and they can get all the information about my tax plan, which is the most aggressive --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I have it. I want to go over with you. So, the top 1 percent pay 30 percent of the taxes. The top 20 percent -- the bottom 50 percent of American wage earners pay 1 percent federal income tax. Fifty percent pays one and the other 50 percent, the rich, who you want to take more from, they pay it all. So, my question is, in your city in New York, let's go over in New York, for example, all right? If the top marginal rate, I don't get the deduction any longer because of the president's tax deal --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I think that's a mistake.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I pay higher taxes.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: But the president was wrong to take away state and local deduction.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, you want me to pay more, so he's making me pay more.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, he was wrong to take away, and by the way, middle-class people come working-class people paid for that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What should the federal tax rate be for individuals, 70 percent?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: For folks who make over $2 million income --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Seventy percent.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Seventy percent, when you combine everything.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That means they get to keep 30 percent.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK, you take 70 cents out of every dollar.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Again, how long did we have this in this country for decades? Dwight Eisenhower, John F. Kennedy, that was the tax rate then.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Seventy cents out of every dollar. Corporations, what should they pay, is the top marginal rate for corporations that you want?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I think right now is way too low.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Give me a number, give a ballpark.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Ballpark, between 40 percent and 50 percent.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. No business is going to want to be in business and they will pass the cost onto the consumers and we will lose jobs. Here's what we have in New York.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Here's the problem, wait a minute.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Whoa, I want to know what I pay in New York, OK? Because I pay the 9 percent state tax, I pay the city tax, you have me have 4 percent, you know, in New York. My income goes to you. I don't even live here. I don't live in the city. By the way, just saying.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You make a good income here.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. New York City has an extra 4.875 sales tax on top of that. Then if people out of 30 percent you're going to let them keep, you want to then come back later and say, well, if you saved millions, I want 1 percent more, 2 percent more, 3 percent more, you want another bite at the apple after they paid their 70 cents on the dollar. One more thing, then if you drop dead, then New York gets another 60 percent.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So, what about the --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And the federal government gets 44 percent.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: What about all the working people who created all the wealth, the guy who owns the factory, the guy who owns the company did not create the wealth. The people did the work create the wealth.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why do you feel you have the right --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: They are not getting their fair share.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. We're just getting started. The mayor has a lot to say, we'll see what he has to say about the wave of -- well, felony, assault, water attacks against the New York City police officers. A lot more ground to cover. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So, for weeks, we've shown you these alarming videos of New York City police officers being assaulted and doused with unknown liquids. Some of them accused the mayor of preventing New York City's finest from adequately responding or making an arrest. So, what is the mayor doing to combat the shocking new trend? Part two of my interview.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I mention the guys you came in this building with. I honor them. They to me are my heroes. That's my family, my extended family. You know, I'm almost -- you can check it out. I applied to be a New York City police officer. And I got 99 on the test, and even pass the psychological, and then the physical. I was going to --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And standards were lower back then.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That was a jackass comment, but it's very good. But here's the point -- I love these guys. We see them doused with water. We see those guys now, those are felony assaults against our bravest.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And those folks are being arrested who did that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. So, I want this promise from you. I hope we'll agree on this. I want every video gone over with a fine-toothed comb and every one of those people that assaulted your officers, our officers, that put a gun on because their jobs are dangerous every day, that protect and serve, I want a promise from you that you can identify every one of those people that attacked those guys --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: That's what we do.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That hasn't happened yet.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Oh, come on!

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You haven't arrested everyone of them. How many have been arrested?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: They've been identified and arrested consistently -- the NYPD does its job.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How many have been arrested?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Wait, wait, wait. Are you saying --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Look at these videos.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm asking a question. Are you asking the NYPD is not doing their job? Let me give you some news.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I am saying those cops deserve better than that.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: They deserve the very best and we are arresting each and every one who did any assaults.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Look, you can look right here, I want you to look.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Every single guy, every single face we see, will you arrest them?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Sean, anybody the NYPD deems who committed a crime will be arrested.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen, I want to say --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Respect the professionals in the NYPD that they are going to follow the law and go after anyone that did anything illegal.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why do you make it so hard?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Because you are playing a game.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm not playing a game.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: This is a serious thing.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm serious. I'm serious as a heart attack!

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you not think the NYPD knows how to do its job? Because I know they know how to do their job.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's my question as a mayor of New York City. You are their boss.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I want you to answer the question. Do you know how to do their job? I'm still not hearing you answering. I'm going to tell you. They know how to do their job. They know how to do their job. They brought down crime consistently. We're the safest big city in America.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I give you credit.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You got to respect the fact that these guys know what they are doing and they're going to bring them everyone to justice. I know that. I know that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But here's my question for you. Every person on video that is assaulting --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Everyone who committed a crime will be brought to justice. Everyone who's committed a crime will be brought to justice.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Will you promise --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: This is incredible. That's not a good enough statement for you that everyone who commits a crime will be brought to justice? That's America. That's America.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is everyone in that video --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I believe our professionals who are police officers know who commits a crime and they will bring them to justice.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is that video evidence over the assault?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Why do you not respect the NYPD enough to do their job?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's a silly statement. I wore NYPD hat and shirt every day.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So, then, why don't you respect them to do their job?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is that a crime that we're looking at, yes or no?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Sean, you either respect them or you don't. Don't play a game here.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No game.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: This is ridiculous. These are professionals.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Will you promise to arrest?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: These are professionals --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Will you promise to do it?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to personally arrest them. The NYPD will arrest tem and they know what they're doing.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you promise to try to arrest everyone?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Of course, anyone who commits a crime of any kind we're going to arrest.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Hallelujah. I got to St. Patrick --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, quit playing the game, man. Stop it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, no, it's not a game to me. That's not a game.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You are playing a game, because you have to acknowledge that this is the finest police force in the nation.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That continues to happen.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Crime has gone --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The murder rate -- you had a low murder rate the last three years. Great. I'm happy. I give you credit.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All credit unto de Blasio.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I give the credit to the NYPD. I put 2,000 officers on patrol. This is an extraordinary police force that is getting better all the time and working more and more closer to communities and that's going to take us forward. But this stuff you are talking about? That's a smokescreen. They know how to do their jobs. They know how to do their job.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Mr. Mayor, this is not a game to me. As long as they're all arrested --

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It's a game if you do not think they know how to do their jobs.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Slow down.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Why do you think they wouldn't arrest people?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: As long as they are all arrested, I'm going to be a happy host.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen, respect the fact --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you want to host the show and interview me one day?

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen to this, respect the fact that we didn't become the safest big city in America by accident. We did it by investing in our police --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Rudy Giuliani started it all.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you know what? David Dinkins, Rudy Giuliani --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, not David Dinkins.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Yes, he did.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: He got -- stop, he got the cops first from Albany, the money from the cops. He did it, it's fact.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. And Rudy implemented it, and was called a racist.

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And then Bloomberg, and then me. But here's the thing. Six years in a row, crime goes down. We've improved relationship between police and community. We've done things that that have not done before that bonded police and community together. We've retrained the entire police force and we've added 2,000 more officers on patrol. Those are the facts.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm going to say this. I'm never going to agree with you. You drive me crazy and you don't answer questions, you know -- you duck a lot. But thank you for coming in. And I take very seriously those men and women. That's my family appear this is our city. I want every person in the city protected. I want you protected. By the way, you should rethink every single New Yorker should have the means to protect themselves with a weapon because you have a--

utterances.speaker: DE BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You have a finest police force in America.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You have the best security in America.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: They have the finest police force in America and we're going to keep making it stronger and stronger.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. You're not going to raise my taxes. Great, I'm going to have to pay more taxes. If you become President--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So kids going to have pre-k.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You want to steal my money?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Kids can have pre-k. So people can have it elsewhere.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I can use my money away anywhere. I don't need it. Up next, the Mayor will weigh in on his party's favorite new socialists proposal The Green New Deal and I'll press him. Wait till you see the exchange we had on abortion. I'll ask him also about his plan to ban glass and steel to build New York City buildings straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So we covered a lot of ground with Mayor De Blasio. We get right back into our interview where I asked the Mayor to explain his party's extreme abortion agenda whether he thinks there should be any restrictions on the procedure at all. Pretty simple question. Does he answer it? Take a look.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay. Now, we have a lot of controversial issues. Do you support any restrictions on abortion?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Look: --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's a simple question.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It's a simple answer. I believe in Roe V. Wade, I believe this decision to attain a women and a doctor.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right, but where it's gotten controversial is for example in Virginia when you have a bill proposed that would allow during birth dilation abortions and a Governor of Virginia that said, well, first we are going to birth the baby and make the baby comfortable hang on then we'll let the mother decide. Do you support any restrictions on abortion? That's a simple question.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It's a simple answer. I believe in Roe V. Wade under choice: --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Roe V. Wade looks at the back to the stage.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Again, what you're going to do and I respects that this is your job. I have a job to do you're your job is you try and make this sometimes a cartoon and--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Not at all.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: --I'm trying to tell what this is about women's rights to choose which is under attack.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay. I have many - I live in New York. I have many friends that are Democrats and consider themselves pro-choice. But, for example, do you think a woman in the ninth month putting aside health, putting aside life of the mother; do you support any restrictions until the baby is born? That's a simple question.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, I believe it's a smoke screen because it doesn't happen in America. We didn't make this choice. It's a sacred choice for women.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: There are now ten states that are debating whether or not you could have them--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: A sacred choice for women.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Ten that are allowing people to have an abortion up until the moment of birth. Do you support that?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Listen, here's the problem with this whole discussion.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We want answer.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No. The problem is that women make this choice. It's a very difficult choice; it's a very personal choice. What we need to respect is that's not a choice any women want to make.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: 8 months into pregnancy.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And the law overwhelmingly Americans believe in protecting right to choose--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm asking you believe you want to be President. 8 months into pregnancy--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I told you what I believe and I'm not--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I don't understand your answer.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here is my simple question. 8 months into pregnancy, should a woman be allowed legally to have an abortion?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Again, I've told you I believe woman's right to choose. This is a smoke screen. I'm not answering your way. I'm answering my way.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay. Let's move on. I want to ask you The Green New Deal. Let's go through the yes or no's first and then I'll let you expand on it. I know you've said about buildings. We aren't going to build it with glass and we are not going to build them with, what do you call it, glass and steel.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Glass and steel. There you go.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I do this for a living.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Okay, say.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And so I told you little bit about my background. We got a little talk before we came on air. That's 20 so much years in my life blue color. My dad worked for the City of New York as a family corroboration guy. My mom was a prison guard. All my family were New York City cops, only two were FBI guys. I was the lost sheep of the family. As I look at that, I think, okay, you are going to tax the hell out of people that want to build with glass and steel, and you're going to put the restrictions on it. My mind goes to my friends. My friends that are cops, firemen, steelworkers, plumbers, electricians--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Are you concerned about people having jobs?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No. What I'm concerned about your plan will prevent tall buildings from being built in this city.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: That is not true at all.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But it is going to cost more according to your own words.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It's very clear Sean. You want to build a skyscraper you can still build a skyscraper? And we want people to look all over New York City.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Sign the dotted line.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: There you go. All over New York City you see cranes, you see construction workers, you see a lot of employment. I believe in that. On my watch, again, 500,000 new permanent jobs and a huge number of construction jobs.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That not answer my question.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, I'm coming to it. So what we say is you can't build the buildings that we used to build that create a huge amount of green house gas emissions. We need be build buildings at a clean. There is a huge amount of work in that. We need buildings to be retrofitted we are going to train workers to do that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Who is going to pay for it? Who is going to pay for the retrofit?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: The building owners when they get the retrofit make the money back over time because they do not spend as much on energy.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you know how much retrofitting could cause the building in New York? Millions.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And that's what we need.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you know and I think they're going to do because I always say that corporations don't pay taxes, the pass it on the consumers. They are going to raise the rent unless of course you confiscate the building which you said you might do if they raise rent.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No, no. Wait, we didn't say anything like that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But if they are going to raise the rent on peoples so the people are going to pay for the retrofit.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: We are going to demand of building owners, build green, stop the greenhouse gas emissions that are killing all of us. I know you care about your children, your grandchildren. I care about my children, their grandchildren.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: About everyone in the city.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So we cannot go on this way. We need a Green New Deal and one of the key things is to make sure buildings don't emit what they are used to now that means a lot of jobs for people to fix those building retrofit those buildings. Build them green and - I assume and I know--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It's going to cost more.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Those building owners are doing very well, can handle the upfront cost and they make it back because retrofit--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You say as if these people have unlimited resources there are some people that I know that own apartments that would have lost money apartments. There are people that I know that own buildings that have lost many buildings.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I believe you, but this is something where you make the money back. But here's the option. If we don't do something, this earth is in great danger. We're in the city--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How many years do we have left? How dangerous is?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It's very dangerous. I believe the U.N. estimate is 12 years before we do with much deeper problems.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What the hell we're looking going for? Let's throw a big party if it's only 12 years we have left?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Let's get to work. The Green New Deal gives us that opportunity.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: If you are going to eliminate steel and glass and there's going to be tens and millions--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Not eliminate it. We say if you don't put the retrofits in--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You got to punish it.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: --put the retrofits in. If you want steel and glass build more green--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Millions more.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: --build it green.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay, that means that everyone who rents those rooms or rent those offices or rent those departments are going to pay more. My question is do you have an alternative--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you want us to do nothing?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: There are other materials that you can use besides steel and glass--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm not the expert on building materials. But there's a lot of innovation out there.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We can't use tooth picks and trees. No we can't use trees.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No. Sean, status quo is not working. The earth is in more and more endangered. Sandy you saw what Sandy did hurricane Sandy in New York City. Look at it we've $40 plus billions in damage. Thousands of lives lost. We have to change. This is why buildings are one of the biggest emitters out there. We have to do something about this law in the New York City is the toughest.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Give me the materials. What are the alternative materials?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I will happily get you a list of building materials.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You don't have the list?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: But the point I'm making to you is we do the status quo, we are endangering the future of this city and this nation.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay, so that means tens and hundreds of millions of dollars and the additional cost to build a new building and retrofit an old building, those costs will be put on the residents of New York?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So you want to do nothing?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I didn't say I want to do nothing.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So why you're giving me an answer. What do you want to do?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I don't buy into this U.N. hysteria but that's the something--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You don't think there is global warming?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I think there is absolutely issues. We need to be good stewards of our environment and by being good stewards. But on the other hand, we have to understand something. The lifeblood of America's economy?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You're not answering.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Follow the bouncing box.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you believe global warming or not? Do you believe we have a problem?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's what I'm telling you. If the lifeblood - follow me and you're going to get your answer. The lifeblood of every economy in this world is oil, gas and coal. Now in the New Green Deal, in ten years, it says it wants to eliminate all use of oil, gas, and coal. Do you support that?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I support us as quickly as possible--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Not answering again.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: --you not even let the sentence finish. First of all you didn't answer so I'll start then I'll give you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'll make a deal with you. When I'm running for President, and you get your own show you get to ask the questions. On my show I'll ask the questions.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: But Sean, you guess you don't have an honest opinion on?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I have an honest opinion. My job is to ask you questions.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Do you believe in global warming or not?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You want to be President?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay, answer my question.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You say global warming--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I will ask you again. Oil and gas are the life part of our economy.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: We have to move off fossil fuels. We have to make sure people on those industries--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How long would you ban it?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: As quickly as possible. We have to make sure people in those industries get job.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: New Green Deal says ten years?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Get off fossil fuels--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How many years?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: --but get people in those industries job in the green as quickly as possible.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So linger didn't work out all the Green New Deals of Obama didn't work out.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So wait a minute. You are saying to me that you don't believe in global warming?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm saying to you just the opposite. I'm saying to you we should be good stewards of our environment--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And what do you want to do different?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm recognizing the truth that you failed to recognize, that every economy in the world is run on oil, gas, coal, and coal. And if America gets off it, as the Green New Deal that you support has, in ten years, you will watch the greatest depression in the quickest period of time, and it will destroy Americans.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So is Germany: --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: They import natural gas from that idiot Putin.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Germany that has moved to renewable--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, they haven't.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Yes. They have. And they are--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Merkel just signed a $7 billion deal to make Russia rich again.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Question is, and you know what--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: This is not your show again. It's my show. See what it says up to your "Hannity" doesn't say De Blasio. I asked that question. You want to be President right?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I want to be really clear we have to get off fossil fuels because it's causing global warming.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How many years?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I wanted it to be fast as possible.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How long around ten fifteen thirty?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: There is the bottom line. We can turn to renewable. We can create jobs in renewable. We can protect our children and grandchildren.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So you think you can - what you are saying is that you think we can transfer our dependence on oil, gas, coal, and transmission to renewable. My question is what are they renewable and how much do they cost?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Right now I look at the equation the other way around. The renewable are wind power, solar power, hydro, geothermal--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We have a lot of room for wind power in New York. Where you are going to put it in the middle of Hudson?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Well you can put in long town which is what people are talking about.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We can put it near the Kennedy Compound.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: The bottom line is these are technologies that are working all over the world. If we don't change quick we are in a lot of danger. I care about what's going to happen to the future generations and I do not like what I see. These weather events do not mistakes, Sean. This stuff is flooding the wild fires, it is happening because of global warming. We can't go on this way.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: In the 70s, you can look at Time Magazine and it said that the new Ice Age is coming. Then it was in the 80s the world is overheating. Then it's now this generality of that is climate change with fits every climate condition even Ocasio-Cortez, Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez the Chief of Staff said Green New Deal had nothing to do with climate change, it's about an agenda a socialist agenda. When we come back, more Bill De Blasio, including something he recently implemented in New York. And he challenged me on it's called Meatless Mondays. I decided we should have a bet. I will show you next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, moments ago I pressed New York City Mayor Bill De Blasio on his big government agenda and even had him explain his support for Meatless Mondays for students. Take a look. I want to go over two more issues and then you should go out and buy me a drink. By the way, you're not going to like get rid of - can we put salt back on the tables in New York you might why did Mayor Bloomberg take away salt shakers from the tables? I'm a big guy. I'm a smart guy. I'd like to make that decision on my own. I don't drink big gulps but don't you think people should have the choice to drink them if they want to drink them?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I actually believe in freedom but I think there are some very--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you!

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: --I want you to know--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You don't want big gulps?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No listen, but there are some very common sense things we do. No, listen. You don't make it easy for a kid to drink a huge amount of soda. They want to buy soda, they can buy soda, but they don't buy the amount of the soda that's going to keep making them obese this doesn't make sense.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Mr. Mayor, I ran the streets. My parents had no clue where I was growing up in long Island. And do you know what I did with the money I made I hung out on a candy store I ate crap, I went to McDonald's.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You and I grew up probably somewhat similar times. We didn't have the obesity problem we have today.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I ate McDonald's, I ate pizza.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Did you see the amount of kids dealing with obesity back then? I did not. Something happened and we got to address it. More and more fast food, it's not good, it's not healthy for the country. By the way do you care about national security?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Then you want a healthy country. You do not want to--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I work out like --I do mix martial arts 90 minutes a day.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Right, but you care--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And up by the way, you have every right to go to Brooklyn 8 miles away to do your stupid workout. That was stupid. I'm defending you. So you tweeted one day about me. You said - it's actually pretty funny, I laugh when I say.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: It's a quality tweet.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, you are wanting Meatless Mondays in school right?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay. You know how I know "Hashtag Meatless Mondays" is a good idea? Because our students love it and at Sean Hannity hates it. That was pretty funny I like that, because I do hate it. I don't want the government telling me--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: And our students do love it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay, are you willing to put money on that?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay let's have a bet. You name the amount I make a lot more than you do? So here's what I would say, let's let every kid in every New York school vote. I say McDonald's Monday, Taco--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: No. Come on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Taco Tuesday. Slow down. Wendy's Wednesdays. Hang on.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: You really are a threat to society.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Pizza Turkey Thursdays and KFC Fridays.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: A lot of parents listening to you right now, you're losing viewers right now among parents. Let me tell you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I don't eat that every day, I wish I could, I will blow up like a balloon and it won't be able on the site. Here's my bet though, that's my menu I'm going to offer and the kids can vote on my menu and they can vote on your menu. You name the price after every New York City student votes, I'll give whatever amount you want to bet to your charity and if you win and you give that amount to my charity.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So the substantive truth, let's just actually get do this.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm going to win.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: By doing this, we are helping kids to be healthier. We've got an obesity problem in our country.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I don't have a problem with that. I don't have a problem with kids: --BLASIO: If kids were given one day, try this option the other days they got the other option, it's balanced.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay. So in Pizza you don't have a problem with it in school? BLASIO I'm a believer in Pizza.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I hate cauliflower Pizza. I'm afraid to admit it with extra cheese. People that get my age just don't burn it off like you used to.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Thank you for your confession.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I don't eat McDonald's a lot. I don't eat McDonald's a lot. I want kids to exercise more. I want more athletics. Schools aren't cutting it. It's got to be the parents.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: When we were coming up they did the President's competition, the athletics, you threw the football through the tire, and your member all that?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I think we got to refocus kids on physical activities.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'll help you with that.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: We got to refocus them on physical activity, we got to a have give them have a healthier diet. There is a lot. But I really emphasize reaching kids that--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But you know they would pick my diet over yours?

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: Reaching kids young with these kind of things helps a lot.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But you know they would pick my diet over yours.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: So you want a bunch of kids deciding the fate of their diet? Is that what you want?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The answer to your question--

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm speaking as a parent.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm speaking as a parent.

utterances.speaker: BLASIO
utterances.utterance: I'm speaking as a parent.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, when we come back, some final thoughts and wow, one thing we didn't show you. Straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, we saved one piece of tonight's interview with Mayor de Blasio. He reacts to President Trump's successful record in comparison to Obama and Biden's failed record. That, you're going to want to see. By the way, I have a message for all your 2020 candidates. Come on the program. We will give you a fair shake. And you can get it -- reach more people than any other show on cable. Let not your heart be troubled. Laura Ingraham, I never like to be late. We'll never be the media mob either. Hi.
